name: WebGLRenderingContext
description: The WebGLRenderingContext interface provides the OpenGL ES 2.0 rendering context for the drawing surface of an HTML <canvas> element.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.canvas
members.description: A read-only back-reference to the HTMLCanvasElement. Might be null if it is not associated with a <canvas> element.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.commit()
members.description: Pushes frames back to the original HTMLCanvasElement, if the context is not directly fixed to a specific canvas.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.drawingBufferWidth
members.description: The read-only width of the current drawing buffer. Should match the width of the canvas element associated with this context.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.drawingBufferHeight
members.description: The read-only height of the current drawing buffer. Should match the height of the canvas element associated with this context.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.getContextAttributes()
members.description: Returns a WebGLContextAttributes object that contains the actual context parameters. Might return null, if the context is lost.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.isContextLost()
members.description: Returns true if the context is lost, otherwise returns false.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.scissor()
members.description: Defines the scissor box.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the horizontal coordinate for the lower left corner of the box. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the vertical coordinate for the lower left corner of the box. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: A non-negative Glsizei specifying the width of the scissor box. Default value: width of the canvas.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A non-negative Glsizei specifying the height of the scissor box. Default value: height of the canvas.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.viewport()
members.description: Sets the viewport.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the horizontal coordinate for the lower left corner of the viewport origin. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the vertical coordinate for the lower left corner of the viewport origin. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: A non-negative Glsizei specifying the width of the viewport. Default value: width of the canvas.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A non-negative Glsizei specifying the height of the viewport. Default value: height of the canvas.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.activeTexture()
members.description: Selects the active texture unit.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.description: The texture unit to make active. The value is a gl.TEXTUREI where I is within the range from 0 to gl.MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS - 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.blendColor()
members.description: Sets the source and destination blending factors.

parameters.name: red
parameters.description: A GLclampf for the red component in the range of 0 to 1.

parameters.name: green
parameters.description: A GLclampf for the green component in the range of 0 to 1.

parameters.name: blue
parameters.description: A GLclampf for the blue component in the range of 0 to 1.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: A GLclampf for the alpha component (transparency) in the range of 0 to 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.blendEquation()
members.description: Sets both the RGB blend equation and alpha blend equation to a single equation.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying how source and destination colors are combined. Must be either: gl.FUNC_ADD: source + destination, gl.FUNC_SUBTRACT: source - destination, gl.FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT: destination - source When using the EXT_blend_minmax extension: ext.MIN_EXT: Minimum of source and destination, ext.MAX_EXT: Maximum of source and destination. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.MIN: Minimum of source and destination, gl.MAX: Maximum of source and destination. default value: gl.FUNC_ADD

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.blendEquationSeparate()
members.description: Sets the RGB blend equation and alpha blend equation separately.

parameters.name: modeRGB
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying how the red, green and blue components of source and destination colors are combined. Must be either: gl.FUNC_ADD: source + destination (default value), gl.FUNC_SUBTRACT: source - destination, gl.FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT: destination - source, When using the EXT_blend_minmax extension: ext.MIN_EXT: Minimum of source and destination, ext.MAX_EXT: Maximum of source and destination. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.MIN: Minimum of source and destination, gl.MAX: Maximum of source and destination.

parameters.name: modeAlpha
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying how the alpha component (transparency) of source and destination colors are combined. Must be either: gl.FUNC_ADD: source + destination (default value), gl.FUNC_SUBTRACT: source - destination, gl.FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT: destination - source, When using the EXT_blend_minmax extension: ext.MIN_EXT: Minimum of source and destination, ext.MAX_EXT: Maximum of source and destination. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.MIN: Minimum of source and destination, gl.MAX: Maximum of source and destination.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.blendFunc()
members.description: Defines which function is used for blending pixel arithmetic.

parameters.name: sfactor
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying a multiplier for the source blending factors. The default value is gl.ONE. For possible values, see below.

parameters.name: dfactor
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying a multiplier for the destination blending factors. The default value is gl.ZERO. For possible values, see below.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.blendFuncSeparate()
members.description: Defines which function is used for blending pixel arithmetic for RGB and alpha components separately.

parameters.name: srcRGB
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying a multiplier for the red, green and blue (RGB) source blending factors. The default value is gl.ONE. For possible values, see below.

parameters.name: dstRGB
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying a multiplier for the red, green and blue (RGB) destination blending factors. The default value is gl.ZERO. For possible values, see below.

parameters.name: srcAlpha
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying a multiplier for the alpha source blending factor. The default value is gl.ONE. For possible values, see below.

parameters.name: dstAlpha
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying a multiplier for the alpha destination blending factor. The default value is gl.ZERO. For possible values, see below.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.clearColor()
members.description: Specifies the color values used when clearing color buffers.

parameters.name: red
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the red color value used when the color buffers are cleared. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: green
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the green color value used when the color buffers are cleared. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: blue
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the blue color value used when the color buffers are cleared. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the alpha (transparency) value used when the color buffers are cleared. Default value: 0.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.clearDepth()
members.description: Specifies the depth value used when clearing the depth buffer.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the depth value used when the depth buffer is cleared. Default value: 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.clearStencil()
members.description: Specifies the stencil value used when clearing the stencil buffer.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the index used when the stencil buffer is cleared. Default value: 0.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.colorMask()
members.description: Sets which color components to enable or to disable when drawing or rendering to a WebGLFramebuffer.

parameters.name: red
parameters.description: A GLboolean specifying whether or not the red color component can be written into the frame buffer. Default value: true.

parameters.name: green
parameters.description: A GLboolean specifying whether or not the green color component can be written into the frame buffer. Default value: true.

parameters.name: blue
parameters.description: A GLboolean specifying whether or not the blue color component can be written into the frame buffer. Default value: true.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: A GLboolean specifying whether or not the alpha (transparency) component can be written into the frame buffer. Default value: true.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.cullFace()
members.description: Specifies whether or not front- and/or back-facing polygons can be culled.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying whether front- or back-facing polygons are candidates for culling. The default value is gl.BACK. Possible values are: gl.FRONT gl.BACK gl.FRONT_AND_BACK

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.depthFunc()
members.description: Specifies a function that compares incoming pixel depth to the current depth buffer value.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the depth comparison function, which sets the conditions under which the pixel will be drawn. The default value is gl.LESS. Possible values are: gl.NEVER (never pass) gl.LESS (pass if the incoming value is less than the depth buffer value) gl.EQUAL (pass if the incoming value equals the the depth buffer value) gl.LEQUAL (pass if the incoming value is less than or equal to the depth buffer value) gl.GREATER (pass if the incoming value is greater than the depth buffer value) gl.NOTEQUAL (pass if the incoming value is not equal to the depth buffer value) gl.GEQUAL (pass if the incoming value is greater than or equal to the depth buffer value) gl.ALWAYS (always pass)

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.depthMask()
members.description: Sets whether writing into the depth buffer is enabled or disabled.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: A GLboolean specifying whether or not writing into the depth buffer is enabled. Default value: true, meaning that writing is enabled.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.depthRange()
members.description: Specifies the depth range mapping from normalized device coordinates to window or viewport coordinates.

parameters.name: zNear
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the mapping of the near clipping plane to window or viewport coordinates. Clamped to the range 0 to 1 and must be less than or equal to zFar. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: zFar
parameters.description: A GLclampf specifying the mapping of the far clipping plane to window or viewport coordinates. Clamped to the range 0 to 1. The default value is 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.disable()
members.description: Disables specific WebGL capabilities for this context.

parameters.name: cap
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying which WebGL capability to disable. Possible values:

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.enable()
members.description: Enables specific WebGL capabilities for this context.

parameters.name: cap
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying which WebGL capability to enable. Possible values:

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.frontFace()
members.description: Specifies whether polygons are front- or back-facing by setting a winding orientation.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Sets the winding orientation. The default value is gl.CCW. Possible values: gl.CW: Clock-wise winding. gl.CCW: Counter-clock-wise winding.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.getParameter()
members.description: Returns a value for the passed parameter name.

parameters.name: pname
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying which parameter value to return. See below for possible values.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.getError()
members.description: Returns error information.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.hint()
members.description: Specifies hints for certain behaviors. The interpretation of these hints depend on the implementation.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Sets which behavior to be controlled. Possible values: gl.GENERATE_MIPMAP_HINT: Quality of filtering when generating mipmap images with WebGLRenderingContext.generateMipmap(). When using the OES_standard_derivatives extension: ext.FRAGMENT_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_HINT_OES: Accuracy of the derivative calculation for the GLSL built-in functions: dFdx, dFdy, and fwidth.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Sets the behavior. The default value is gl.DONT_CARE. The possible values are: gl.FASTEST: The most efficient behavior should be used. gl.NICEST: The most correct or the highest quality option should be used. gl.DONT_CARE: There is no preference for this behavior.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.isEnabled()
members.description: Tests whether a specific WebGL capability is enabled or not for this context.

parameters.name: cap
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying which WebGL capability to test. Possible values:

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.lineWidth()
members.description: Sets the line width of rasterized lines.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.pixelStorei()
members.description: Specifies the pixel storage modes

parameters.name: pname
parameters.description: A Glenum specifying which parameter to set. See below for possible values.

parameters.name: param
parameters.description: A GLint specifying a value to set the pname parameter to. See below for possible values.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.polygonOffset()
members.description: Specifies the scale factors and units to calculate depth values.

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: A GLfloat which sets the scale factor for the variable depth offset for each polygon. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: A GLfloat which sets the multiplier by which an implementation-specific value is multiplied with to create a constant depth offset. The default value is 0.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.sampleCoverage()
members.description: Specifies multi-sample coverage parameters for anti-aliasing effects.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A GLclampf which sets a single floating-point coverage value clamped to the range [0,1]. The default value is 1.0.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: A GLboolean which sets whether or not the coverage masks should be inverted. The default value is false.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.stencilFunc()
members.description: Sets the both front and back function and reference value for stencil testing.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the test function. The default function is gl.ALWAYS. The possible values are: gl.NEVER:       Never pass. gl.LESS:         Pass if (ref & mask) <  (stencil & mask). gl.EQUAL:       Pass if (ref & mask) =  (stencil & mask). gl.LEQUAL:     Pass if (ref & mask) <= (stencil & mask). gl.GREATER:   Pass if (ref & mask) >  (stencil & mask). gl.NOTEQUAL: Pass if (ref & mask) != (stencil & mask). gl.GEQUAL:     Pass if (ref & mask) >= (stencil & mask). gl.ALWAYS:     Always pass.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the reference value for the stencil test. This value is clamped to the range 0 to 2n -1 where n is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying a bit-wise mask that is used to AND the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The default value is all 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.stencilFuncSeparate()
members.description: Sets the front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying whether the front and/or back stencil state is updated. The possible values are: gl.FRONT gl.BACK gl.FRONT_AND_BACK

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the test function. The default function is gl.ALWAYS. The possible values are: gl.NEVER:       Never pass. gl.LESS:         Pass if (ref & mask) <  (stencil & mask). gl.EQUAL:       Pass if (ref & mask) =  (stencil & mask). gl.LEQUAL:     Pass if (ref & mask) <= (stencil & mask). gl.GREATER:   Pass if (ref & mask) >  (stencil & mask). gl.NOTEQUAL: Pass if (ref & mask) != (stencil & mask). gl.GEQUAL:     Pass if (ref & mask) >= (stencil & mask). gl.ALWAYS:     Always pass.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the reference value for the stencil test. This value is clamped to the range 0 to 2n -1 where n is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying a bit-wise mask that is used to AND the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The default value is all 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.stencilMask()
members.description: Controls enabling and disabling of both the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying a bit mask to enable or disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. By default, the mask is all 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.stencilMaskSeparate()
members.description: Controls enabling and disabling of front and/or back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying whether the front and/or back stencil writemask is updated. The possible values are: gl.FRONT gl.BACK gl.FRONT_AND_BACK

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying a bit mask to enable or disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. By default, the mask is all 1.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.stencilOp()
members.description: Sets both the front and back-facing stencil test actions.

parameters.name: fail
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the function to use when the stencil test fails. The default value is gl.KEEP.

parameters.name: zfail
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the function to use when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. The default value is gl.KEEP.

parameters.name: zpass
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the function to use when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and there is no depth buffer or depth testing is disabled. The default value is gl.KEEP.

parameters.name: gl.KEEP
parameters.description: Keeps the current value.

parameters.name: gl.ZERO
parameters.description: Sets the stencil buffer value to 0.

parameters.name: gl.REPLACE
parameters.description: Sets the stencil buffer value to the reference value as specified by WebGLRenderingContext.stencilFunc().

parameters.name: gl.INCR
parameters.description: Increments the current stencil buffer value. Clamps to the maximum representable unsigned value.

parameters.name: gl.INCR_WRAP
parameters.description: Increments the current stencil buffer value. Wraps stencil buffer value to zero when incrementing the maximum representable unsigned value.

parameters.name: gl.DECR
parameters.description: Decrements the current stencil buffer value. Clamps to 0.

parameters.name: gl.DECR_WRAP
parameters.description: Decrements the current stencil buffer value. Wraps stencil buffer value to the maximum representable unsigned value when decrementing a stencil buffer value of 0.

parameters.name: gl.INVERT
parameters.description: Inverts the current stencil buffer value bitwise.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.stencilOpSeparate()
members.description: Sets the front and/or back-facing stencil test actions.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying whether the front and/or back stencil state is updated. The possible values are: gl.FRONT gl.BACK gl.FRONT_AND_BACK

parameters.name: fail
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the function to use when the stencil test fails. The default value is gl.KEEP.

parameters.name: zfail
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the function to use when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. The default value is gl.KEEP.

parameters.name: zpass
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the function to use when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and there is no depth buffer or depth testing is disabled. The default value is gl.KEEP.

parameters.name: gl.KEEP
parameters.description: Keeps the current value.

parameters.name: gl.ZERO
parameters.description: Sets the stencil buffer value to 0.

parameters.name: gl.REPLACE
parameters.description: Sets the stencil buffer value to the reference value as specified by WebGLRenderingContext.stencilFunc().

parameters.name: gl.INCR
parameters.description: Increments the current stencil buffer value. Clamps to the maximum representable unsigned value.

parameters.name: gl.INCR_WRAP
parameters.description: Increments the current stencil buffer value. Wraps stencil buffer value to zero when incrementing the maximum representable unsigned value.

parameters.name: gl.DECR
parameters.description: Decrements the current stencil buffer value. Clamps to 0.

parameters.name: gl.DECR_WRAP
parameters.description: Decrements the current stencil buffer value. Wraps stencil buffer value to the maximum representable unsigned value when decrementing a stencil buffer value of 0.

parameters.name: gl.INVERT
parameters.description: Inverts the current stencil buffer value bitwise.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.bindBuffer()
members.description: Binds a WebGLBuffer object to a given target.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target). Possible values: gl.ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer containing vertex attributes, such as vertex coordinates, texture coordinate data, or vertex color data. gl.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer used for element indices. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.COPY_READ_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.COPY_WRITE_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER: Buffer for transform feedback operations. gl.UNIFORM_BUFFER: Buffer used for storing uniform blocks. gl.PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations. gl.PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.description: A WebGLBuffer to bind.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.bufferData()
members.description: Updates buffer data.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target). Possible values: gl.ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer containing vertex attributes, such as vertex coordinates, texture coordinate data, or vertex color data. gl.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer used for element indices. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.COPY_READ_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.COPY_WRITE_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER: Buffer for transform feedback operations. gl.UNIFORM_BUFFER: Buffer used for storing uniform blocks. gl.PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations. gl.PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: A GLsizeiptr setting the size of the buffer object's data store.

parameters.name: srcData Optional
parameters.description: An ArrayBuffer, SharedArrayBuffer or one of the ArrayBufferView typed array types that will be copied into the data store. If null, a data store is still created, but the content is uninitialized and undefined.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the usage pattern of the data store. Possible values: gl.STATIC_DRAW: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and not change often. Contents are written to the buffer, but not read. gl.DYNAMIC_DRAW: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and change often. Contents are written to the buffer, but not read. gl.STREAM_DRAW: Contents of the buffer are likely to not be used often. Contents are written to the buffer, but not read. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.STATIC_READ: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and not change often. Contents are read from the buffer, but not written. gl.DYNAMIC_READ: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and change often. Contents are read from the buffer, but not written. gl.STREAM_READ: Contents of the buffer are likely to not be used often. Contents are read from the buffer, but not written. gl.STATIC_COPY: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and not change often. Contents are neither written or read by the user. gl.DYNAMIC_COPY: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and change often. Contents are neither written or read by the user. gl.STREAM_COPY: Contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and not change often. Contents are neither written or read by the user.

parameters.name: srcOffset
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying the element index offset where to start reading the buffer.

parameters.name: length Optional
parameters.description: A GLuint defaulting to 0.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.bufferSubData()
members.description: Updates buffer data starting at a passed offset.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target). Possible values: gl.ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer containing vertex attributes, such as vertex coordinates, texture coordinate data, or vertex color data. gl.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer used for element indices. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.COPY_READ_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.COPY_WRITE_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER: Buffer for transform feedback operations. gl.UNIFORM_BUFFER: Buffer used for storing uniform blocks. gl.PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations. gl.PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: A GLintptr specifying an offset in bytes where the data replacement will start.

parameters.name: data Optional
parameters.description: An ArrayBuffer, SharedArrayBuffer or one of the ArrayBufferView typed array types that will be copied into the data store.

parameters.name: srcOffset
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying the element index offset where to start reading the buffer.

parameters.name: length Optional
parameters.description: A GLuint defaulting to 0.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.createBuffer()
members.description: Creates a WebGLBuffer object.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.deleteBuffer()
members.description: Deletes a WebGLBuffer object.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.description: A WebGLBuffer object to delete.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.getBufferParameter()
members.description: Returns information about the buffer.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A Glenum specifying the target buffer object. Possible values: gl.ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer containing vertex attributes, such as vertex coordinates, texture coordinate data, or vertex color data. gl.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER: Buffer used for element indices. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.COPY_READ_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.COPY_WRITE_BUFFER: Buffer for copying from one buffer object to another. gl.TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER: Buffer for transform feedback operations. gl.UNIFORM_BUFFER: Buffer used for storing uniform blocks. gl.PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations. gl.PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER: Buffer used for pixel transfer operations.

parameters.name: pname
parameters.description: A Glenum specifying information to query. Possible values: gl.BUFFER_SIZE: Returns a GLint indicating the size of the buffer in bytes. gl.BUFFER_USAGE: Returns a GLenum indicating the usage pattern of the buffer. This is either: gl.STATIC_DRAW, gl.DYNAMIC_DRAW, gl.STREAM_DRAW. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.STATIC_READ, gl.DYNAMIC_READ, gl.STREAM_READ, gl.STATIC_COPY, gl.DYNAMIC_COPY, gl.STREAM_COPY.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.isBuffer()
members.description: Returns a Boolean indicating if the passed buffer is valid.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.description: A WebGLBuffer to check.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.bindFramebuffer()
members.description: Binds a WebGLFrameBuffer object to a given target.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target). Possible values: gl.FRAMEBUFFER: Collection buffer data storage of color, alpha, depth and stencil buffers used to render an image. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER: Equivalent to gl.FRAMEBUFFER. Used as a destination for drawing, rendering, clearing, and writing operations. gl.READ_FRAMEBUFFER: Used as a source for reading operations.

parameters.name: framebuffer
parameters.description: A WebGLFramebuffer object to bind.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.checkFramebufferStatus()
members.description: Returns the status of the framebuffer.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target). Possible values: gl.FRAMEBUFFER: Collection buffer data storage of color, alpha, depth and stencil buffers used to render an image. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER: Equivalent to gl.FRAMEBUFFER. Used as a destination for drawing, rendering, clearing, and writing operations. gl.READ_FRAMEBUFFER: Used as a source for reading operations.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.createFramebuffer()
members.description: Creates a WebGLFrameBuffer object.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.deleteFramebuffer()
members.description: Deletes a WebGLFrameBuffer object.

parameters.name: framebuffer
parameters.description: A WebGLFramebuffer object to delete.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.framebufferRenderbuffer()
members.description: Attaches a WebGLRenderingBuffer object to a WebGLFrameBuffer object.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target) for the framebuffer. Possible values: gl.FRAMEBUFFER: Collection buffer data storage of color, alpha, depth and stencil buffers used to render an image. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER: Equivalent to gl.FRAMEBUFFER. Used as a destination for drawing, rendering, clearing, and writing operations. gl.READ_FRAMEBUFFER: Used as a source for reading operations.

parameters.name: attachment
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the attachment point for the render buffer. Possible values: gl.COLOR_ATTACHMENT0: color buffer. gl.DEPTH_ATTACHMENT: depth buffer. gl.STENCIL_ATTACHMENT: stencil buffer. members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.readPixels()
members.description: Reads a block of pixels from the WebGLFrameBuffer.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the first horizontal pixel that is read from the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the first vertical pixel that is read from the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the width of the rectangle.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the height of the rectangle.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the format of the pixel data. Possible values: gl.ALPHA: Discards the red, green and blue components and reads the alpha component. gl.RGB: Discards the alpha components and reads the red, green and blue components. gl.RGBA: Red, green, blue and alpha components are read from the color buffer.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the data type of the pixel data. Possible values: gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5 gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4 gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1 gl.FLOAT

parameters.name: pixels
parameters.description: An ArrayBufferView object to read data into. The array type must match the type of the type parameter. Uint8Array for gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE. Uint16Array for gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, or gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1. Float32Array for gl.FLOAT.

parameters.name: dstOffset Optional
parameters.description: Offset. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A Glenum specifying the target renderbuffer object. Possible values: gl.RENDERBUFFER: Buffer data storage for single images in a renderable internal format.

parameters.name: pname
parameters.description: A Glenum specifying the information to query. Possible values: gl.RENDERBUFFER_WIDTH: Returns a GLint indicating the width of the image of the currently bound renderbuffer. gl.RENDERBUFFER_HEIGHT: Returns a GLint indicating the height of the image of the currently bound renderbuffer. gl.RENDERBUFFER_INTERNAL_FORMAT: Returns a GLenum indicating the internal format of the currently bound renderbuffer. The default is gl.RGBA4. Possible return values: gl.RGBA4: 4 red bits, 4 green bits, 4 blue bits 4 alpha bits. gl.RGB565: 5 red bits, 6 green bits, 5 blue bits.  gl.RGB5_A1: 5 red bits, 5 green bits, 5 blue bits, 1 alpha bit. gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT16: 16 depth bits. gl.STENCIL_INDEX8: 8 stencil bits. gl.RENDERBUFFER_GREEN_SIZE: Returns a GLint that is the resolution size (in bits) for the green color. gl.RENDERBUFFER_BLUE_SIZE: Returns a GLint that is the resolution size (in bits) for the blue color. gl.RENDERBUFFER_RED_SIZE: Returns a GLint that is the resolution size (in bits) for the red color. gl.RENDERBUFFER_ALPHA_SIZE: Returns a GLint that is the resolution size (in bits) for the alpha component. gl.RENDERBUFFER_DEPTH_SIZE: Returns a GLint that is the resolution size (in bits) for the depth component. gl.RENDERBUFFER_STENCIL_SIZE: Returns a GLint that is the resolution size (in bits) for the stencil component. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following value is available additionally: gl.RENDERBUFFER_SAMPLES: Returns a GLint indicating the number of samples of the image of the currently bound renderbuffer.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.copyTexImage2D()
members.description: Copies a 2D texture image.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target) of the active texture. Possible values: gl.TEXTURE_2D: A two-dimensional texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X: Positive X face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X: Negative X face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y: Positive Y face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y: Negative Y face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z: Positive Z face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z: Negative Z face for a cube-mapped texture.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the level of detail. Level 0 is the base image level and level n is the nth mipmap reduction level.

parameters.name: internalformat
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the color components in the texture. Possible values: gl.ALPHA: Discards the red, green and blue components and reads the alpha component. gl.RGB: Discards the alpha components and reads the red, green and blue components. gl.RGBA: Red, green, blue and alpha components are read from the color buffer. gl.LUMINANCE: Each color component is a luminance component, alpha is 1.0. gl.LUMINANCE_ALPHA: Each component is a luminance/alpha component.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the x coordinate of the lower left corner where to start copying.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the y coordinate of the lower left corner where to start copying.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the width of the texture.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the height of the texture.

parameters.name: border

parameters.name: pname
parameters.description: A Glenum specifying the information to query. Possible values: pname Return type Description Possible return values Available in a WebGL 1 context gl.TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER GLenum Texture magnification filter gl.LINEAR (default value), gl.NEAREST. gl.TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER GLenum Texture minification filter gl.LINEAR, gl.NEAREST, gl.NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST, gl.LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST, gl.NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR (default value), gl.LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR. gl.TEXTURE_WRAP_S GLenum Wrapping function for texture coordinate s gl.REPEAT (default value), gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE, gl.MIRRORED_REPEAT. gl.TEXTURE_WRAP_T GLenum Wrapping function for texture coordinate t gl.REPEAT (default value), gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE, gl.MIRRORED_REPEAT. Additionally available when using the EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic extension ext.TEXTURE_MAX_ANISOTROPY_EXT GLfloat Maximum anisotropy for a texture Any float values. Additionally available when using a WebGL 2 context gl.TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL GLint Texture mipmap level Any int values. gl.TEXTURE_COMPARE_FUNC GLenum Comparison function gl.LEQUAL (default value), gl.GEQUAL, gl.LESS, gl.GREATER, gl.EQUAL, gl.NOTEQUAL, gl.ALWAYS, gl.NEVER. gl.TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE GLenum Texture comparison mode gl.NONE (default value), gl.COMPARE_REF_TO_TEXTURE. gl.TEXTURE_IMMUTABLE_FORMAT GLboolean Immutability of the texture format and size true or false. gl.TEXTURE_IMMUTABLE_LEVELS GLuint ? Any uint values. gl.TEXTURE_MAX_LEVEL GLint Maximum texture mipmap array level Any int values. gl.TEXTURE_MAX_LOD GLfloat Texture maximum level-of-detail value Any float values. gl.TEXTURE_MIN_LOD GLfloat Texture minimum level-of-detail value Any float values. gl.TEXTURE_WRAP_R GLenum Wrapping function for texture coordinate r gl.REPEAT (default value), gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE, gl.MIRRORED_REPEAT.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.texImage2D()
members.description: Specifies a 2D texture image.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the binding point (target) of the active texture. Possible values: gl.TEXTURE_2D: A two-dimensional texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X: Positive X face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X: Negative X face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y: Positive Y face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y: Negative Y face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z: Positive Z face for a cube-mapped texture. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z: Negative Z face for a cube-mapped texture.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the level of detail. Level 0 is the base image level and level n is the nth mipmap reduction level.

parameters.name: internalformat
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the color components in the texture. Possible values: gl.ALPHA: Discards the red, green and blue components and reads the alpha component. gl.RGB: Discards the alpha components and reads the red, green and blue components. gl.RGBA: Red, green, blue and alpha components are read from the color buffer. gl.LUMINANCE: Each color component is a luminance component, alpha is 1.0. gl.LUMINANCE_ALPHA: Each component is a luminance/alpha component. When using the WEBGL_depth_texture extension: gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT gl.DEPTH_STENCIL When using the EXT_sRGB extension: ext.SRGB_EXT ext.SRGB_ALPHA_EXT When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.R8 gl.R16F gl.R32F gl.R8UI gl.RG8 gl.RG16F gl.RG32F gl.RG8UI gl.RG16UI gl.RG32UI gl.RGB8 gl.SRGB8 gl.RGB565 gl.R11F_G11F_B10F gl.RGB9_E5 gl.RGB16F gl.RGB32F gl.RGB8UI gl.RGBA8 gl.SRGB8_APLHA8 gl.RGB5_A1 gl.RGB10_A2 gl.RGBA4 gl.RGBA16F gl.RGBA32F gl.RGBA8UI

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the width of the texture.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the height of the texture.

parameters.name: border
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the width of the border. Must be 0.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the format of the texel data. In WebGL 1, this must be the same as internalformat (see above). in WebGL 2, the combinations are listed in this table.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the data type of the texel data. Possible values: gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE: 8 bits per channel for gl.RGBA gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5: 5 red bits, 6 green bits, 5 blue bits. gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4: 4 red bits, 4 green bits, 4 blue bits, 4 alpha bits. gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1: 5 red bits, 5 green bits, 5 blue bits, 1 alpha bit. When using the WEBGL_depth_texture extension: gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT gl.UNSIGNED_INT ext.UNSIGNED_INT_24_8_WEBGL (constant provided by the extension) When using the OES_texture_float extension: gl.FLOAT When using the OES_texture_half_float extension: ext.HALF_FLOAT_OES (constant provided by the extension) When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.BYTE gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT gl.SHORT gl.UNSIGNED_INT gl.INT gl.HALF_FLOAT gl.FLOAT gl.UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV gl.UNSIGNED_INT_10F_11F_11F_REV gl.UNSIGNED_INT_5_9_9_9_REV gl.UNSIGNED_INT_24_8 gl.FLOAT_32_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8_REV (pixels must be null)

parameters.name: pixels
parameters.description: One of the following objects can be used as a pixel source for the texture: ArrayBufferView, A Uint8Array must be used if type is gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE. A Uint16Array must be used if type is either gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT or ext.HALF_FLOAT_OES. A Uint32Array must be used if type is gl.UNSIGNED_INT or ext.UNSIGNED_INT_24_8_WEBGL. A Float32Array must be used if type is gl.FLOAT. ImageData, HTMLImageElement, HTMLCanvasElement, HTMLVideoElement, ImageBitmap.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: (WebGL 2 only) A GLintptr byte offset into the WebGLBuffer's data store. Used to upload data to the currently bound WebGLTexture from the WebGLBuffer bound to the PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER target.

parameters.name: pname
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the information to query. Possible values: gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING: Returns the currently bound WebGLBuffer. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_ENABLED: Returns a GLboolean that is true if the vertex attribute is enabled at this index. Otherwise false. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_SIZE: Returns a GLint indicating the size of an element of the vertex array. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_STRIDE: Returns a GLint indicating the number of bytes between successive elements in the array. 0 means that the elements are sequential. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_TYPE: Returns a GLenum representing the array type. One of gl.BYTE, gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE, gl.SHORT, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT, gl.FIXED, gl.FLOAT. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_NORMALIZED: Returns a GLboolean that is true if fixed-point data types are normalized for the vertex attribute array at the given index. gl.CURRENT_VERTEX_ATTRIB: Returns a Float32Array (with 4 elements) representing the current value of the vertex attribute at the given index. When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_INTEGER: Returns a GLboolean indicating whether or not an integer data type is in the vertex attribute array at the given index. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_DIVISOR: Returns a GLint describing the frequency divisor used for instanced rendering. When using the ANGLE_instanced_arrays extension: ext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_DIVISOR_ANGLE: Returns a GLint describing the frequency divisor used for instanced rendering.

members.description: Specifies a value for a generic vertex attribute.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying the position of the vertex attribute to be modified.

parameters.name: v0, v1, v2, v3
parameters.description: A floating point Number for the vertex attribute value.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.vertexAttribPointer()
members.description: Specifies the data formats and locations of vertex attributes in a vertex attributes array.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: A GLuint specifying the index of the vertex attribute that is to be modified.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the number of components per vertex attribute. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the data type of each component in the array. Possible values: gl.BYTE: signed 8-bit integer, with values in [-128, 127] gl.SHORT: signed 16-bit integer, with values in [-32768, 32767] gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE: unsigned 8-bit integer, with values in [0, 255] gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT: unsigned 16-bit integer, with values in [0, 65535] gl.FLOAT: 32-bit floating point number When using a WebGL 2 context, the following values are available additionally: gl.HALF_FLOAT: 16-bit floating point number

parameters.name: normalized
parameters.description: A GLboolean specifying whether integer data values should be normalized when being casted to a float. If true, signed integers are normalized to [-1, 1]. If true, unsigned integers are normalized to [0, 1]. For types gl.FLOAT and gl.HALF_FLOAT, this parameter has no effect.

parameters.name: stride
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the offset in bytes between the beginning of consecutive vertex attributes. Cannot be larger than 255.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: A GLintptr specifying an offset in bytes of the first component in the vertex attribute array. Must be a multiple of type.

members.description: Renders primitives from array data.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the type primitive to render. Possible values are: gl.POINTS: Draws a single dot. gl.LINE_STRIP: Draws a straight line to the next vertex. gl.LINE_LOOP: Draws a straight line to the next vertex, and connects the last vertex back to the first. gl.LINES: Draws a line between a pair of vertices. gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP gl.TRIANGLE_FAN gl.TRIANGLES: Draws a triangle for a group of three vertices.

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: A GLint specifying the starting index in the array of vector points.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the number of indices to be rendered.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.drawElements()
members.description: Renders primitives from element array data.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the type primitive to render. Possible values are: gl.POINTS: Draws a single dot. gl.LINE_STRIP: Draws a straight line to the next vertex. gl.LINE_LOOP: Draws a straight line to the next vertex, and connects the last vertex back to the first. gl.LINES: Draws a line between a pair of vertices. gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP gl.TRIANGLE_FAN gl.TRIANGLES: Draws a triangle for a group of three vertices.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: A GLsizei specifying the number of elements to be rendered.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A GLenum specifying the type of the values in the element array buffer. Possible values are: gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT When using the OES_element_index_uint extension: gl.UNSIGNED_INT

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: A GLintptr specifying an offset in the element array buffer. Must be a valid multiple of the size of the given type.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.finish()
members.description: Blocks execution until all previously called commands are finished.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.flush()
members.description: Empties different buffer commands, causing all commands to be executed as quickly as possible.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.getSupportedExtensions()
members.description: Returns an Array of DOMString elements with all the supported WebGL extensions.

members.name: WebGLRenderingContext.getExtension()
members.description: Returns an extension object.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A String for the name of the WebGL extension to enable.
